original: @130b * // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsgom pa'i don mdor bsdus te bstan pa //
analyzed: @130b * // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsgom pa'i don mdor bsdus te bstan pa //
translated: A brief presentation of the meaning of meditation for the Yogācāra

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i ye shes de ni rtag pa dang chad par lta ba rnams kyis thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i ye shes de ni rtag pa dang chad par lta ba rnams kyis thob par mi nus te /
translated: That wisdom as it has been described cannot be attained by those who hold the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: 'di ltar gal te yod par rnam par rtog na ni de'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yod par rnam par rtog na ni de'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: If one conceives of it as existent, then one will fall into the extreme of grasping at eternalism.

original: ji ste med par rnam par rtog na ni de lta na yang chad par lta ba'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste med par rnam par rtog na ni de lta na yang chad par lta ba'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one conceives of it as nonexistent, then one will fall into the extreme of the view of nihilism.

original: de bas na 'di ni dbu ma'i lam gyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas ye shes de nyid de lta bur lta ba rnams kyis thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni dbu ma'i lam gyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas ye shes de nyid de lta bur lta ba rnams kyis thob par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since it is the nature of this wisdom to arise through the middle way, it cannot be attained by those who hold such views.

original: de bas na dbu ma'i lam la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //🔽dbu ma'i lam las byung ba yi //
analyzed: de bas na dbu ma'i lam la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir // dbu ma'i lam las byung ba yi //
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should therefore strive in the middle way, it is said:🔽The wisdom that arises from the middle way

original: ye shes rnam par mi rtog de //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par mi rtog de //
translated: Is nonconceptual.

original: rtag par chad pa lta rnams kyis //
analyzed: rtag par chad pa lta rnams kyis //
translated: The views of eternalism and annihilationism

original: thob par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: are not able to attain it.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dbu ma'i lam de yang dpyad na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam de yang dpyad na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de /
translated: Moreover, that middle way, when analyzed, is just mere representation.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ni gtsor na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ni gtsor na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po mtshon pa'o //
translated: Mere representation is the principal indication of the thing that is dependent origination.

original: gzhan gyi dbang 'khrul pa tsam yin pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang 'khrul pa tsam yin pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir //
translated: Since it is just the error of the other-dependent, it appears as the duality of apprehended and apprehender.

original: gal te ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod na ni rtag pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod na ni rtag pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed as it appears, then there would be the extreme of eternalism.

original: ci ste ci yang med na ni de lta na chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste ci yang med na ni de lta na chad par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it did not exist at all, then there would be the extreme of annihilationism.

original: de lta bas na gdags pa'i gzhi yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gdags pa'i gzhi yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that the basis of designation exists.🔽Thus it is said:

original: de'i phyir / dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba yang //
translated: The so-called middle way

original: rnam rig tsam nyid ma gtogs par //🔽rigs pas brtags na 'dir gzhan ni //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam nyid ma gtogs par // rigs pas brtags na 'dir gzhan ni //
translated: is just mere representation.🔽When analyzed by reasoning,

original: rnam pa kun tu mi 'thad do //🔽zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu mi 'thad do //🔽zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: nothing else is tenable in any way.

original: /'on bdas dang rigs mthun pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: /'on bdas dang rigs mthun pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra of the Questions of Revata states:

original: kun dga' bo yod ces bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo yod ces bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ānanda, to say “it exists” is eternalism.

original: med ces bya ba chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: To say “it does not exist” is nihilism.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dbu ma'i lam gyi chos ston to zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dbu ma'i lam gyi chos ston to zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma of the middle way.

original: de ni nyes pa med de //🔽gtso bor gang zag @131a * //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de // gtso bor gang zag @131a * //
translated: There is no fault here.🔽The Buddha taught this primarily

original: dgag pa'i phyir gsungs kyi //🔽gzhan gtso bor byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir gsungs kyi // gzhan gtso bor byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: in order to refute the person.🔽He did not teach it primarily in order to establish mere consciousness.

original: gzhan gtso bor mdzad pa ma yin pa de yang gang zag gis gsal bar mdzad pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gtso bor mdzad pa ma yin pa de yang gang zag gis gsal bar mdzad pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha taught this in order to clarify the person.

original: de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du dbu ma'i lam du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du dbu ma'i lam du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established the middle way as mere consciousness,

original: de la gzung ba'i phyir /🔽rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod rnams kyis //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i phyir / rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod rnams kyis //
translated: in order to refute the object of that consciousness,🔽he said:🔽In order to generate nonconceptual wisdom

original: mi rtog ye shes skyed pa'i phyir //🔽de bas rnam par rig tsam du //
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes skyed pa'i phyir // de bas rnam par rig tsam du //
translated: in those who desire complete enlightenment,🔽therefore, one should always apply

original: bsgom pa rtag tu sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsgom pa rtag tu sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the meditation on mere consciousness.

original: gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de dag gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de dag gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood should cultivate nonconceptual wisdom.

original: 'di thams cad ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du bsgom pa la rtag tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du bsgom pa la rtag tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment should always apply themselves to cultivating the mere representation, thinking, “All this is mere representation,” in order to accomplish nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de ltar rnam par rig par snang ba mthong ba skyes te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rig par snang ba mthong ba skyes te /
translated: Thus, the appearance of representation is seen.

original: thams cad la dngos po'i ngo bo mi mthong na /
analyzed: thams cad la dngos po'i ngo bo mi mthong na /
translated: When one does not see the entityness of anything,

original: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa yang med do zhes rnam par rig pa tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa yang med do zhes rnam par rig pa tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: one does not see even mere representation, thinking, “Without an object, there is no subject.”

original: de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa dang bral bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa dang bral bas /
translated: Therefore, free from the conception of object and subject,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: nonconceptual wisdom arises spontaneously.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pa la rtag tu sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pa la rtag tu sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One should always apply oneself to cultivation.”

original: 'di ni phan yon yin pas de'i phyir sgrims shig ces ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni phan yon yin pas de'i phyir sgrims shig ces ston to //
translated: This is the benefit, therefore be diligent.

original: de ltar de bsgom pa la mngon par brtson pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa ni sa bcu rim gyis rnam par rtog pa rnam par 'jig pas mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bsgom pa la mngon par brtson pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa ni sa bcu rim gyis rnam par rtog pa rnam par 'jig pas mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong ste /
translated: Thus, the wise one who is intent on cultivating this sees the nature of non-conceptuality through the gradual destruction of the ten stages of conceptualization.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid gnyis po gang yin pa de yang gnyis med kyi ngo bo nyid du rtog cing /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid gnyis po gang yin pa de yang gnyis med kyi ngo bo nyid du rtog cing /
translated: He realizes that the nature of the duality of grasped and grasper is non-dual.

original: 'di na brtag par bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'di na brtag par bya ba yang med la /
translated: Here, there is nothing to be examined,

original: rtog pa yang med de /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med de /
translated: and there is no examination.

original: 'di thams cad med pa la sgro btags pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di thams cad med pa la sgro btags pa yin pas /
translated: Since all of this is a superimposition on the non-existent,

original: 'di kun ni rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes nges par byed de /
analyzed: 'di kun ni rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes nges par byed de /
translated: it is like a dream.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / rnam rtog mi rtog bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam rtog mi rtog bdag nyid yin //
translated: It has the nature of non-conceptualization and conceptualization.

original: gnyis dang gnyis med bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis med bdag nyid de /
translated: It has the nature of duality and non-duality.

original: 'di dag thams cad rmi lam bzhin //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rmi lam bzhin //
translated: All of this is like a dream.

original: 'di la brtag bya med rtog med //
analyzed: 'di la brtag bya med rtog med //
translated: Here, there is nothing to be examined and no examination.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ni 'di skad du phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma gtogs par chos phra rab tsam yang med de //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma gtogs par chos phra rab tsam yang med de //
translated: This is what is being taught: “Except for the error, not even the slightest phenomenon exists.

original: de bas na phyin ci log spangs tsam zhig bya bar zad do zhes bstan par @131b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na phyin ci log spangs tsam zhig bya bar zad do zhes bstan par @131b 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the only thing to do is to abandon error.”🔽“No entity is added

original: dngos po gang yang bsnan med cing //🔽bsal ba mad de de yi phyir //
analyzed: dngos po gang yang bsnan med cing // bsal ba mad de de yi phyir //
translated: and no entity is removed.”

original: zhes bya bas ni de nyid sgrub par byed de /🔽'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni de nyid sgrub par byed de / 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: This is the proof of that.🔽“There is nothing to be removed

original: gzhag par bya ba ci yang med //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba ci yang med //
translated: from this, and nothing to be added.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: See reality as it is.

original: yang dag mthong bas rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong bas rnam par grol //
translated: When you see reality, you are liberated.”

original: zhes bya ba ste de'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de'i phyir //
translated: Therefore,

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid //🔽de bzhin nyid tsam mthong bas grol //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid // de bzhin nyid tsam mthong bas grol //
translated: “The nature of phenomena

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: is seen as suchness alone, and that is liberation.”

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsgom pa'i don mdor bsdus te bstan pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsgom pa'i don mdor bsdus te bstan pa /
translated: The Summary of the Meaning of Meditation for Yogācāra

original: slob dpon ye shes zla bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon ye shes zla bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: is completed.

original: // / rtsa ba slob dpon klu'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa lags so /
analyzed: // / rtsa ba slob dpon klu'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa lags so /
translated: The root text was composed by Ācārya Nāgāmitra.
